nodes.documentation: * Events **
nodes.name: Transfer

nodes.documentation: Constructor function

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not enough ether to buy a standard pack"

arguments.value: Not enough ether to buy a standard pack

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not enough ether to buy a standard pack"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "No more Standard Kards left to issue"

arguments.value: No more Standard Kards left to issue

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "No more Standard Kards left to issue"

nodes.documentation:
Function for buying a standard pack of kards (kards with no effect)
Checks that there is enough kards left to buy, randomly selects the number
of kards in a pack, and assigns them to the buyer.
nodes.name: buyStandardPack

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not enough ether to buy a platinum pack"

arguments.value: Not enough ether to buy a platinum pack

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not enough ether to buy a platinum pack"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "No more Platinum Kards left to issue"

arguments.value: No more Platinum Kards left to issue

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "No more Platinum Kards left to issue"

nodes.documentation:
Function for buying a platinum pack of kards (kards with an effect)
Checks that there is enough kards left to buy, randomly selects the number
of kards in a pack, and assigns them to the buyer.
nodes.name: buyPlatinumPack

nodes.documentation: External transfer function, used for trading amongst users
nodes.name: transfer

nodes.documentation: Returns an array of kardId's that the owner owns
nodes.name: getOwnedKards

nodes.documentation:
Withdrawal function so the contract owner can withdraw funds from the contract.
This is here to show that the contract holds the ether used to buy the kards
until the contract owner withdrawals the ether.
nodes.name: withdraw

nodes.documentation:
Internal transfer function. Checks the ownership of the kardId, removes the
kard from the current owners array of owned kardId's, and assigns the kard
to it's new owner.
nodes.name: _transfer

nodes.documentation:
Internal function used to issue new Kards from the store.
Given a randomIndex (or kardId), this will check if the kardId is already owned
If it is, then it will go to the next kard in the list, and repeat until
there is a kard with no owner
nodes.name: issueStandardKard

nodes.documentation: Same functionality as above function, just with different bounds for platinum.
nodes.name: issuePlatinumKard

nodes.documentation:
Internal function for checking ownership.
Returns true if the address at the kardId index is the same as the address passed in
nodes.name: owns

nodes.documentation:
Random function adapted from src: https://medium.com/promentol/lottery-smart-contract-can-we-generate-random-numbers-in-solidity-4f586a152b27
This relies on trusting the transaction mining node. While this function is NOT safe
for PUBLIC blockchains, in a permissioned blockchain system, malicious miners can have
their node removed from the network.
nodes.name: random
